medical_history.chief_complaint: Primary amenorrhea in 46,XY sisters with gonadal dysgenesis and associated seminoma.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient 1 first seen at age 17 with primary amenorrhea, minimal breast development, and pubic hair. Symptoms of numbness of feet and hands began in her early 20s and ascended over time. Patient 2 also presented with primary amenorrhea at age 17 similar to patient 1. Both had increasing symptoms of polyneuropathy.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient 1 had a surgical intervention for an inguinal hernia in early childhood. Patient 2 underwent gonadectomy and vaginoplasty due to suspected androgen biosynthesis defect but no other surgeries or chronic conditions are specified.
medical_history.family_history: The patients are sisters born to first cousins, indicating possible hereditary patterns, but no specific family conditions are detailed.
medical_history.social_history: The family moved from Syria to Germany during the siblings' childhood, but no specific lifestyle factors or habits are mentioned.
